sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 3rd person singular masculine bound pronoun after a vowel.

revisionDesc.change: updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

item.label: vowel is lengthened and stressed and h is optional

cit.quote: in him, by him, with him

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The author proposes that the use of this bound pronoun serves to prevent ambiguity with the feminine suffix, ex. kaṛāsī-u "his chairs" vs kaṛāsī-h "her chairs" (Cantineau 1937:181).
This value is attested after all vowels except after ā, where the value would be -wh (Prochazka 1988:128).
This value is attested only after ā, whereas all other vowels are followed by the value -h (Prochazka 1988:128).
The h is often inaudible when in pause.
Assimilation of h occurs for instance in ma ramēnāšši 'we did not throw it (m.sg.)'.
The h is often inaudible when in pause.
The h is often inaudible when in pause.
he h is often inaudible when in pause.
